main event: Two prospectors reported a large circular object crashing to the ground in Death Valley on August 8, 1949.
interesting points: The object was observed to have a diameter of approximately 24 feet and a thickness of 7 feet., Two small, heavily clothed men were seen running from the crash site and disappearing over a ridge., The material of the object was described as iridescent, primarily composed of calcium, and radioactive., A portion of the object was taken by one of the observers, who stated it had small green wires running throughout., The object resembled the turret of a tank, with rings on its outer surface.
witness description: prospector individuals, one of whom had a scientific background
